articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Official Interviewed as Regards Issue of UN Human Rights Office in Cambodia
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Official Interviewed as Regards Issue of UN Human Rights Office in Cambodia
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Hwang Chol, deputy director general of the Asian Department 2 of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, was interviewed by KCNA on Nov. 10 with regard to the fact that the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia branded the UN Human Rights Office in its country as an "illegal organization" on Nov. 6.
					 He said that Cambodia expressed such attitude because the office has been active illegally nearly for a year since the validity of the MoU on cooperation which the office concluded with the ministry expired.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 What matters is that the office has blatantly violated the principle of respect for sovereignty and non-interference in other country's internal affairs, the basic principle of the international relations, meddling in Cambodia's political affairs.
					
					 In this connection the Cambodian government clarified its stand that the Cambodian government would not renew the MoU unless the UN includes the wording in the MoU that it would respect the sovereignty of Cambodia and will not intervene in its internal affairs,
					
					 This proves that although the UN pulls up other countries over "their human rights issues" every year, it is aligning itself with some forces' hostile acts against sovereign states in breach of the principle of impartiality in human rights issues.
					
					 Hwang said that he was once again convinced that the human rights precisely mean sovereignty through the activities of the office, adding that the DPRK would firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and add luster to the advantages of Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses, no matter what others may say.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Impudent Act to Mislead World Public Opinion Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Impudent Act to Mislead World Public Opinion Assailed
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Senior researcher of the Disarmament and Peace Institute of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Ju Wang Hwan made public a commentary titled "Impudent act aimed to mislead the world public opinion" on Thursday which said:
					 According to the south Korean media, traitor Park Geun Hye decided not to take part in the 24th APEC summit due in Lima, Peru from upcoming 18th to 19th.
					
					 A spokesman for the south Korean puppet Foreign Ministry on Nov. 8 told the sheer lie that "the president already decided in September not to take part in the summit with full consideration given to the serious security situation prevailing on the Korean peninsula including the fifth nuclear test of the north".
					
					 We do not care whether the traitor takes part in the summit or not but what should not be overlooked is the puppet forces' act of explaining the reason in linkage with the DPRK.
					
					 The main reason for her being unable to take part in the summit is the internal situation of south Korea which has turned into utter confusion due to the hideous scandal. This is also because even though she takes part in the summit, nobody would talk to the "vegetable president" whose support rate is just 5 per cent and the "criminal president" subject to prosecution's investigation.
					
					 But the traitor's efforts to explain the reason in linkage with the DPRK cannot be construed otherwise than a symptom of delirium which can never be understood with proper thinking faculty, rather than a crafty method.
					
					 Now south Koreans from all walks of life query "Is this a country?" over the internal affairs which Park put beyond control. This kind of question can be raised only in south Korea which has turned abnormal internally and externally.
					
					 The awkward excuse made by the puppet forces for Park's inability to take part in the summit fully reveal that the "assertions" made by Park and officials of south Korea in  international arena and "promises" made by them to other countries were hypocritical sophism prompted by arbitrary decision bereft of elementary political sense.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces would be well advised to stop at once the impudent and childish act of finding fault with others to mislead the world public opinion.

articles.title: Photo Exhibition Marking Sixth Congress of KDWU Opens
articles.content:
Photo Exhibition Marking Sixth Congress of KDWU Opens
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition marking the Sixth Congress of the Korean Democratic Women's Union (KDWU) "Sun and Korean Women's Movement" was opened with due ceremony on Thursday at the People's Palace of Culture.
					 On display at the venue of the exhibition were the photo of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing on Mt. Paektu with a broad smile on their faces and other photos on the revolutionary exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu who indicated the orientation and ways for the Korean women's movement to follow and led it.
					
					 Among them are "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Guiding Third Congress of the KDWU," "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Enjoying Art Performance Given by Art Groups of Officers' Wives of the Korean People's Army Units," "The Respected Comrade Kim Jong Un Congratulating Participants in Fourth National Meeting of Mothers" and "Anti-Japanese War Hero Kim Jong Suk among Officials of KDWU."
					
					 There are more than 150 photos showing the Korean women working hard with patriotism and affection for the prosperity of the country and happiness of the big socialist family.

articles.title: Ryongaksan Soap Factory Goes Operational
articles.content:
Ryongaksan Soap Factory Goes Operational
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The newly built Ryongaksan Soap Factory went operational with due ceremony on Thursday.
					 The construction of the factory where production processes have been put on an automated and unmanned basis and an integrated production system has been established laid a foundation for providing the people with varieties of liquid soap and detergent that ensure the best quality and highest hygienic safety.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants planted trees and went round various places of the factory.

articles.title: National Printing Sci-Tech Presentation Held
articles.content:
National Printing Sci-Tech Presentation Held
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- There took place a national printing sci-tech presentation at the Pyongyang General Printing Plant on Nov. 9 and 10.
					 The event was held under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					
					 It was attended by officials, teachers, researchers, technicians, graduate students, three revolution team members in the field of printing.
					
					 The participants heard more than 50 papers presented by the Publication Guidance Bureau, the Pyongyang General Printing Plant, the Publication and Printing Scientific Research Institute, Pyongyang University of Printing, the Foreign Languages Publishing House, etc. 
					
					 Introduced there were the successes and experience gained in the work to put the printing industry on a modern and IT basis and locally produce raw and other materials and equipment at a higher level.
					
					 There was a lecture dealing with the issues arising in the establishment of the system for putting publication on an IT basis and the integrated production system of printing plants during the presentation.
					
					 A closing ceremony was held on Nov. 10.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Visit to Mongolia and Anniversary of Victory of Mongolian People's Revolution Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Visit to Mongolia and Anniversary of Victory of Mongolian People's Revolution Marked
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- There took place a film show at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club in the joint name of the Korea-Mongolia Friendship Association and the Mongolian Embassy here on Thursday on the 60th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's visit to Mongolia and the 95th anniversary of the victory of the Mongolian people's revolution.
					 Present there were Pak Kyong Il, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the Korea-Mongolia Friendship Association, officials concerned, Suren Tsoggerel, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy. 
					
					 The participants enjoyed a Mongolian documentary film.
					
					 A friendly sports game was held between members of the Korea-Mongolia Friendship Association and staff members of the Mongolian Embassy on the same day.

articles.title: Delegation of Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League Leaves for Namibia
articles.content:
Delegation of Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League Leaves for Namibia
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist Youth League headed by Secretary of its Central Committee Jong Yong Won left here on Thursday to participate in the second international preparatory meeting of the 19th World Festival of Youth and Students and the meeting of the General Council of the World Federation of Democratic Youth to be held in Windhoek, Namibia.

articles.title: 41st ACM-ICPC Asia Pyongyang Regional Contest Held
articles.content:
41st ACM-ICPC Asia Pyongyang Regional Contest Held
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- There took place the 41st ACM-ICPC Asia Pyongyang Regional Contest at Kim Il Sung University on Nov. 9 and 10.
					 The students that prove successful in the preliminaries sponsored by the most prestigious universities are expected to take part in the finals.
					
					 Students of the DPRK proved successful at the world finals of the 40th contest held in May and thus the DPRK obtained the qualifications to host the regional contest, helping more students advance into the world contest.
					
					 Over 120 students selected from 28 universities of the DPRK, divided into 42 groups, took part in the Pyongyang regional contest.
					
					 The students succeeded in correctly solving the problems by pooling wisdom.
					
					 The standings were announced.

articles.title: Results from Recovery Effort in Disaster Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Results from Recovery Effort in Disaster Areas of DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A big progress has been made in the embankment project and the restoration of roads in Yonsa and Musan counties, some of the flood-hit areas in the northern part of the DPRK.
					 In Yonsa County, servicepersons finished a project for improving the Yonmyon Stream and the embankment in 1,500 meter-long section, removing 60 000 cubic meters of earth only in ten days.
					
					 Shock brigade members from different parts of the country, including those of the Paektusan Hero Youth Brigade, too, carried out the embankment along the Yonmyon Stream by removing 28,900 cubic meters of earth and laying 4,200 square meters of stones.
					
					 In Musan County, shock brigade members of the Ministry of People's Security completed the embankment along the Tuman River in 500 meter-long section.
					
					 Members of the Construction Shock Brigade 922 carried out much portion of the project for restoring the 30 km-long roads in the county.
					
					 Also, road improvement has been made smoothly in some 40 km-long section of Pinse Pass and Chophyong Pass.

articles.title: Fish Catch Increased in DPRK
articles.content:
Fish Catch Increased in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Fishery stations in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea are now making great results in fishing.
					 According to data available, those run by the Korean People's Army caught more than 10 000 tons of fish in recent few days.
					
					 From late October, fishery stations under the Ministry of Fisheries have raised their fish catch twice as against the same period of last year.
					
					 The Yanghwa Fishery Station caught more than 20 tons of fish at a haul to the maximum. Meanwhile, Wonsan and other fishery stations across the country are registering good results in fishing by introducing advanced methods.

articles.title: Full-length Novel "Field Train" Sees Light
articles.content:
Full-length Novel "Field Train" Sees Light
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The April 15 Literary Production Centre recently produced the full-length novel "Field Train". The novel, part of the serial "Immortal Guidance", was written by Paek Nam Ryong.
					 The novel is set in the period from the beginning of Juche 100 (2011) to the end of December. It depicts the last period of the revolutionary career of leader Kim Jong Il who made high-intensity forced march to the forefront of the revolution to mix with people all his life.
					
					 It also deals with the ardent loyalty and sense of moral obligation with which Marshal Kim Jong Un assisted Kim Jong Il with loyalty accompanying him and made sure that the sacred history of immortalizing the great leaders is given steady continuity.
					
					 The novel says the life of Kim Jong Il was the noblest one of the great revolutionary and peerless patriot who devoted his all to the country and its people, adding that thanks to Kim Jong Un the revolutionary history of Kim Jong Il is given steady continuity.

articles.title: Sosong District Juvenile Sports School of DPRK
articles.content:
Sosong District Juvenile Sports School of DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Sosong District Juvenile Sports School in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK is well-known to the country for having produced a large number of sports stars.
					 The school has groups of football, volleyball, basketball, table tennis, wrestling and other events, and it has been a model in training the country's reserve athletes.
					
					 Among its graduates is Kim Song I of the Amnokgang Sports Team, who won a women's single table tennis bronze medal at the 31st Olympic Games. They also include Jong Il Gwan, who had a hat trick in the finals of the 2010 Asian U-19 Football Championship, Yang Kyong Il, a twice world wrestling champion holder, and Yang Chun Song, a twice Asian wrestling champion holder.
					
					 A girl volleyball team run by the school has won in the national contest every year, and a lot of graduates are now playing the key role at the DPRK's women volleyball teams.
					
					 The school has carried out the teaching and training programs on a scientific basis and positively introduced the advanced methods and means in keeping with schoolchildren's age and their physical and technical preparedness.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Racket over "Security Crisis" Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Racket over "Security Crisis" Denounced
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article denounces the Park Geun Hye group for kicking up war hysteria while talking about "threat from the north" and "security crisis" at a time when it is stuck in the mire of total collapse due to the unprecedentedly hideous scandal.
					The Park group's loud-mouthed "security crisis" is aimed to deliberately escalate the tension by citing the non-existent "provocation" and "threat" and start a war against the north, the article says, and goes on:
					
					This is a trite method employed by the Park group to tide over the extreme ruling crisis caused by the above-said scandal.
					
					It is a well-known fact that the puppet ruling forces kicked up a racket over "security crisis" and war hysteria while vociferating about "provocation from the north" whenever they faced a ruling crisis.
					
					The Park group is now mired in the swamp of destruction.
					
					Thrown into extreme uneasiness and horror, traitor Park is seeking a way out of them in fanning up "security crisis" and staging war exercises. She is, at the same time, making desperate efforts to weather her ruling crisis by diverting elsewhere the attention of the enraged public.
					
					Pushed into a tight corner, being cursed and denounced by the public, she may go so reckless as to perpetrate armed provocation in the worst case. This is by no means a baseless prediction.
					
					The racket over "security crisis" can never be a cure-all and the puppet forces' stereotyped farce will never work, the article notes, stressing that no matter what madcap saber-rattling the Park group may stage against the north over "security crisis," it will never help seek a way out.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dynamically Advancing for Final Victory with Firm Faith in Socialism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dynamically Advancing for Final Victory with Firm Faith in Socialism
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday editorially calls for dynamically advancing toward the final victory with firm faith in socialism.
					 The revolutionary traits of the Korean people who are making a long journey of the revolution with transparent faith in socialism have been fully displayed this significant year in which the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea was held, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 The long history of the Korean revolution is the one in which it victoriously explored the socialist cause of Juche and has advanced it by dint of faith despite manifold difficulties.
					
					 The new century of Juche represents a period in which the issue of faith in socialism is raised as a top priority issue on which hinge the rise and fall of the revolution, and in which the revolutionary faith is regarded as dearer than anything else.
					
					 The anti-Japanese guerilla forces fought with faith in sure victory despite the encirclement of the enemies in the past and all the service personnel and people ushered in the new era of prosperity despite unprecedented sanctions and pressure of the imperialist reactionaries. When we wage a courageous struggle with firm faith in justice of Korean-style socialism and sure victory just as they did, we can usher in the golden age of the revolution and build the best and powerful country, the paradise for the people.
					
					 For the Korean people the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un precisely means the socialist homeland and his leadership the victory of Korean-style socialism.
					
					 A revolutionary soldier's transparent faith in socialism finds a vivid manifestation in remaining true to Kim Jong Un's ideology and leadership no matter which way the wind may blow and even at the risk of one's own life, entrusting one's destiny entirely to him. 
					
					 When all service personnel and people bring about epochal changes by displaying matchless self-sacrificing spirit and popular heroism in all construction sites for putting into practice the plan and determination of the Party, the hurrah for the Workers' Party and socialism will resound far and wide.

articles.title: U.S. Sanctions against DPRK Bound to Go Bankrupt: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Sanctions against DPRK Bound to Go Bankrupt: Rodong Sinmun 
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- James Clapper, director of National Intelligence, recently confessed that the Obama administration's sanctions against the DPRK have proved ineffective and it is absolutely impossible to force the DPRK to dismantle its nukes, sparking off huge furor in the American political circle and the Western world.
					 Addressing a seminar sponsored by the Council of Foreign Relations, a think-tank headquartered in Washington, he had the trouble of admitting that the denuclearization of Korea has already lost its meaning, stressing that the U.S. and its allies in Asia would soon witness the DPRK's missiles tipped with nuclear warheads targeting them. He even added such advice that the next U.S. administration will have to make a very difficult decision during the early period of its term in order to prevent such dangerous situation.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday comments that Clapper's remarks about "impossibility of making the DPRK give up its nuclear program" sound true and realistic.
					
					 No matter how desperately the U.S. ruling forces and tricksters rack their brains to achieve their objective, they can hardly seek any effective means for making the DPRK give up its nukes.
					
					 The awkward position of the U.S. ruling quarters who have worked hard to stifle the DPRK through sanctions since the outset of the 21st century clearly proved how futile the sanctions are.
					
					 It has been a tradition that the successive U.S. presidents starting from Truman were compelled to leave office with gloomy faces after bringing a heavier burden of executing hostile policy toward the DPRK to their successors than what they had shouldered. The snowballing burden caused the successor to take greater pain as it is directly related to the rise or fall of the U.S.
					
					 Clapper made a serious advice in the transition period of the U.S. administration. 
					
					 It was a daydream of the U.S. in the past to force the DPRK to dismantle its nukes and the latter's access to nuclear weapons and its steady bolstering of nuclear force are stark realities today. It is a Don Quixote way of thinking to reverse the history of the DPRK which emerged as a nuclear power from a non-nuclear state.
					
					 Only victory and glory are always in store for the DPRK fully demonstrating the dignity and might of a nuclear power under the uplifted banner of self-development-first principle.

articles.title: Minju Joson Demands Japanese Authorities Stop Suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan at Once
articles.content:
Minju Joson Demands Japanese Authorities Stop Suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan at Once
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities and the right-wing reactionaries have become ever more undisguised in their moves against the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). This is prompted by their black-hearted intention to tarnish the prestige of the dignified DPRK, a nuclear giant in the East, and stir up unrest and horror in the Korean community by inciting anti-DPRK and anti-Chongryon sentiments in the international community, zealously pursuant to the U.S. policy of isolating and stifling the DPRK, and thus suppress and stamp out Chongryon at any cost.
					 Minju Joson Thursday observes this in a commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese authorities are now hell-bent on threatening the personal safety and life of Koreans in Japan and on the moves to disband Chongryon, a legitimate organization, far from making an apology and reparation for their past crimes. This is another crime against humanity which deserves the punishment of Heaven.
					
					 Standing behind Chongryon and Koreans in Japan are the DPRK and the entire Korean nation.
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon such sinister politically-motivated terrorism and brutal persecution but decisively counter them.
					
					 The Japanese authorities had better stop such suppression at once, bearing in mind that their persecution and suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan would only harden the will of the service personnel and the people of the DPRK to take revenge upon them and that they will have to pay a high price for them.

articles.title: S. Korean Labor Circle Demands Dissolution of Jongyongryon
articles.content:
S. Korean Labor Circle Demands Dissolution of Jongyongryon
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- According to media reports, the labor circle of south Korea is demanding dissolution of the "National Federation of Businessmen" (Jongyongryon).
					 The Federation of Trade Unions held a press conference outside the building of Jongyongryon on Nov. 7. Big businesses pretend to have had their money wrested by the regime, but in fact, they had dealing with it, being blinded by the urge for "greed", it held.
					
					 The Confederation of Trade Unions said it has been disclosed through the scandal that the Park Geun Hye regime and capitalists are in cahoots with each other.
					
					 A person concerned with the labor circle stressed the need to build public opinion for dissolving Jongyongryon and intensify solidarity among other labor bodies.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Prosecution's Deceptive Investigation Exposed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Prosecution's Deceptive Investigation Exposed
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- It has been recently disclosed in south Korea that the puppet prosecution did the ringleaders of the "Park Geun Hye-Choe Sun Sil scandal" kind offices, sparking off public uproar.
					 The prosecution spread a rumor that it summoned U Pyong U, former senior secretary for civil administration of Chongwadae and pretended to make a strict investigation into him.
					
					 But according to media of south Korea, when U appeared at the Prosecutor's Office on Nov. 6, the chief of investigation brought tea to U in his room, currying favor with U.
					
					 On Oct. 31 Choe Sun Sil secretly returned home, whisked off her savings at a bank to other place and got the time to erase evidence. This would be unthinkable apart from the patronage and help of the prosecution.
					
					 The parliamentary spokesman for the opposition Minju Party held a press conference at the "National Assembly" on Nov. 7 at which he held that the words that the prosecution is put under the control of U are not a lie.
					
					 A lawmaker from an opposition party accused the prosecution of deciding not to openly summon and investigate U.

articles.title: KCTU Demands Guarantee of Peaceful Grand March
articles.content:
KCTU Demands Guarantee of Peaceful Grand March
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- According to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo, the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions on Nov. 8 held a press conference outside the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency to demand the puppet police authorities fully guarantee the peaceful grand march of the people to be staged as part of the people's all-out people's.
					 The press release said the police's blocking of the peaceful grand march of the people means admitting that the police are the forces protecting not only the monopolization of administration behind the scene but unjust power, forsaken by the people. 
					
					 It urged the police authorities not to block the peaceful grand march to Chongwadae to be staged on Nov. 12.

articles.title: Youths and Students Clarify Their Will to Bring Down Park
articles.content:
Youths and Students Clarify Their Will to Bring Down Park
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The 2016 youth all-out promotion committee made up of 15 youth and students organizations including Youth Solidarity issued a declaration on the situation in the name of 7,128 youths in Seoul on Nov. 9, according to the south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News.
					 The declaration said that more than 300,000 people turned out in actions across south Korea on Nov. 5, adding that it is the final order of the enraged people for Park Geun Hye to step down.
					
					 It demanded Park step down at once as she lost trust of youth as well as qualifications and justice.
					
					 Youths will bring Park down by force unless she steps down by Nov. 12, said the declaration.

articles.title: S. Korean Bodies Denounce Deceptive "Childcare Policy"
articles.content:
S. Korean Bodies Denounce Deceptive "Childcare Policy"
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- According to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People, the Women's Solidarity of south Korea and the Pusan Parents' Solidarity for Genuine Childcare on Nov. 8 held a press conference in Seoul to denounce the deceptive "childcare policy" of the Park Geun Hye regime.
					 The organizations branded the Park Geun Hye regime as incompetent one as it has not established childcare facilities nor guaranteed maternity leaves in the face of the lowest birth rate in south Korea.
					
					 They urged Park to step down, saying that her regime is incompetent and has no qualifications to administrate state affairs.
					
					 They expressed the will to carry on actions till Park Geun Hye steps down as she deceived and flouted the people.

articles.title: "Chongryon Branch Conference-2016" Held
articles.content:
"Chongryon Branch Conference-2016" Held
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The "Chongryon Branch Conference-2016" was held at Korean University in Tokyo on Nov. 6.
					  Present there were Chairman Ho Jong Man and Vice-Chairman Nam Sung U of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), advisors of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, department directors of its Central Standing Committee, chairpersons of the headquarters of Chongryon and the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, delegates of branches, leading officials of organizations and enterprises of Chongryon, full-time and part-time officials of the headquarters and branches of Chongryon and part-time activists of organizations including the Korean Youth Commercial Association in Japan.
					
					  A congratulatory message sent by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK to the conference was read out at the conference.
					
					  Ho Jong Man in his report said that during the period under review the branches of Chongryon and the women's union have conducted brisk movement for setting a patriotic example in the new heyday according to the 10-point goal which applied the teachings given by Marshal Kim Jong Un for the work of branches.
					
					 A video sent by the homeland was shown at the conference.
					
					 Speeches were made.
					
					  Citations of patriotic model branches and citations of model branches of different sectors and model branch flags were awarded to exemplary branches of Chongryon.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was read out.
					
					 The letter said that the branches, the basic living unit of Koreans in Japan, have comprehensively implemented the five-point task set forth by Kim Jong Un in his important May 25 letter and thus glorified the conference as a decisive leaping occasion in demonstrating the might of Chongryon and ushering in a new heyday of the movement of Koreans in Japan.
					
					 There took place a photo exhibition and art performance that day.

articles.title: New York Times Terms Park Geun Hye Most Unpopular "President"
articles.content:
New York Times Terms Park Geun Hye Most Unpopular "President"
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The New York Times on Nov. 7 carried an article branding Park Geun Hye as the most unpopular "president".
					 It said that Park Geun Hye called on the speaker of the south Korean "National Assembly" and demanded that the opposition parties nominate a new "prime minister" to clear off the power-scandal suspicions which neutralized the "government" function for several weeks.
					
					 It noted the opinion poll showed that Park Geun Hye is the most unpopular "president" in south Korea since the 1980s.

articles.title: Anniversary of Formation of DIU Observed by Foreign Bodies
articles.content:
Anniversary of Formation of DIU Observed by Foreign Bodies
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign bodies posted special write-ups on websites from October 10 to 16 on the occasion of the 90th anniversary of formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association posted an article titled "The Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the DIU" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The article noted that the DIU formed by Kim Il Sung is the first revolutionary organization against imperialism in Korea and the WPK is the party that carried forward the organization's revolutionary tradition.
					
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article illustrated with his photo.
					
					 The article said that the Korean revolution started under the banner of the DIU has made a long drive of 90 years, adding that he formed the DIU on Oct. 17, 1926 and clearly indicated its programme for struggle.
					
					 It noted that he defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation, built socialism centered on the popular masses on the land of Korea and leader Kim Jong Il firmly defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation in the period of unprecedentedly stern trials and provided an eternal foundation for building a socialist power.
					
					 The National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo posted an article titled "Historical roots of the WPK".

articles.title: Nepal-DPRK Center for Study of Socialism Formed
articles.content:
Nepal-DPRK Center for Study of Socialism Formed
 Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The Nepal-DPRK Center for the Study of Socialism was formed in Katmandu, Nepal on Nov. 3.
					 Manik Lama, chairman of the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics, was elected chairman of the center.

articles.title: Joint Seminar Supporting Korean People's Just Cause Held in Cairo
articles.content:
Joint Seminar Supporting Korean People's Just Cause Held in Cairo
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar on the theme of "Realistic proposals for Korea's reunification" took place in Cairo on Nov. 1.
					Displayed at the venue of the seminar were photos dealing with Songun leadership exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Also on display there were their works and publications introducing the Korean people's just cause.
					
					Present there were figures of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and media.
					
					Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, explained in detail the idea for national reunification set forth by Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					He said:
					
					Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il laid down the fairest and most realistic proposals for national reunification and dedicated their all to realizing them.
					
					The proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo is, indeed, the reasonable one for Korea's reunification.
					
					The DPRK which is demonstrating its might as a nuclear weapons state under the wise guidance of HE Kim Jong Un who is carrying forward the cause of the great leaders is registering the world-startling successes in building a socialist power while smashing every challenge of the hostile forces.
					
					The participants in the seminar expressed their firm support and solidarity with the Korean people in their just cause for realizing the country's independent reunification.

articles.title: Funcionario del MINREX se entrevista con ACNC en tema de la oficina de DDHH en Cambodia
articles.content:
Funcionario del MINREX se entrevista con ACNC en tema de la oficina de DDHH en Cambodia
Pyongyang, 10 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hwang Chol, subtitular de la Direccion no.2 de Asia del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC se entrevisto el dia 10 con un reportero de la ACNC en relacion con que el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y Cooperacion Internacional del Reino de Camboya califico el dia 6 de "aparato ilegal" a la Oficina de DDHH de la ONU en su pais.
					En la ocasion, Hwang senalo que tal posicion de Camboya se debe a que la Oficina de DDHH de la ONU siguio actuando ilegalmente durante casi un ano desde el vencimiento de la nota de entendimiento sobre la cooperacion suscrita con dicho ministerio camboyano, y prosiguio:
					
					Lo problematico del caso es que esa oficina ha violado flagrantemente los principios fundamentales de relaciones internacionales, o sea, el respeto a la soberania y la no intervencion en asuntos internos, entremetiendose en los asuntos politicos de Cambodia. 
					
					Al respecto, el gobierno camboyano expuso la posicion de no renovar la nota de entendimiento si la ONU no incluye el parrafo de respetar la soberania de Camboya y no intervenir en sus asuntos internos. 
					
					El hecho demuestra que si bien la ONU discute anualmente el problema de DDHH de otros paises, se adhiere a los actos hostiles de algunas fuerzas contra los Estados soberanos violando el principio de imparcialidad en el tema de DDHH. 
					
					A traves del presente caso, nos convencemos una vez mas que los DDHH son precisamente los derechos del Estado.
					
					Digan lo que digan otros, defenderemos con firmeza la soberania del pais y pondremos de pleno manifiesto las ventajas del socialismo por nuestro estilo centrado en las masas populares.

articles.title: Investigador del MINREX comenta acto cinico de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Investigador del MINREX comenta acto cinico de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 10 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El investigador superior del Instituto de Desarme y Paz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ju Wang Hwan, publico el dia 10 un comentario titulado "Acto descarado para inducir en error la opinion publica mundial" que sigue:
					Segun la prensa surcoreana, la traidora Park Geun-hye decidio no participar en la 24a cumbre de la Cooperacion Economica de Asia-Pacifico (APEC) a efectuarse en Lima del Peru los dias 18 y 19 de noviembre.
					
					El dia 8, el vocero del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores del Sur de Corea mintio que "la presidenta habia decidido ya en septiembre ausentarse en la cumbre tomando en consideracion la quinta prueba nuclear del Norte (de Corea) y otras graves circunstancias para la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana".
					
					No nos importa que Park participe o no en la cumbre de APEC, pero no podemos pasar por alto que los titeres surcoreanos traten de atribuirlo a la RPDC.
					
					La causa de ausencia esta en la situacion interna del Sur de Corea, convertido en escenario caotico por el inaudito escandalo. Aunque ella participe, nadie querra tratarse con la "presidenta vegetativa" con 5 % de aceptacion popular y la "delincuente" que se vio obligada a aceptar la investigacion de la fiscalia.
					
					El intento de vincular la causa con la RPDC es mas un delirio incomprensible con el sano modo de pensar que un truco taimado.
					
					En cuanto a la deplorable situacion interna causada por Park Geun-hye, los habitantes de diferentes sectores del Sur de Corea formulan esta pregunta: "?Es este un pais?". Esta interrogacion puede surgir solo en el suelo surcoreano donde lo todo esta anormal en el ambito interno y el externo.
					
					A traves de la excusa extravagante de esta vez, se conoce evidentemente que las "opiniones" expresadas hasta ahora por Park y las autoridades titeres surcoreanas en los escenarios internacionales y sus "promesas" hechas con otros paises son sofismas que partieron de la hipocresia y del egocentrismo carente de elemental sentido politico.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos deberan cesar ahora mismo los actos pueriles y descarados como enganar la opinion publica mundial acusando a otros.

articles.title: Inaugurada exposicion de fotos por el VI Congreso de UMDC
articles.content:
Inaugurada exposicion de fotos por el VI Congreso de UMDC
Pyongyang, 10 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada la exposicion de fotos "El Sol y el movimiento femenino coreano", dedicada al VI Congreso de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea.
					En la sede de galeria estaba expuesta una foto con imagenes sonrientes del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, parados en el monte Paektu.
					
					Se ven las otras alusivas a las hazanas revolucionarias de los grandes hombres sin pares del monte Paektu quienes indicaron el rumbo y remedios para el movimiento femenino coreano y lo dirigieron sabiamente.
					
					Entre ellas figuran las tituladas "El gran Lider camarada Kim Il Sung dirigiendo el III Congreso de la UMDC", "El gran Dirigente camarada Kim Jong Il presenciando la funcion de los grupos artisticos de esposas de oficiales de las unidades del Ejercito Popular de Corea", "El estimado camarada Kim Jong Un felicitando a los participantes en la IV Conferencia Nacional de Madres", "La Heroina de Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk entre las funcionarias de la UMDC".
					
					Estan exhibidas tambien mas de 150 fotos que muestran el aspecto de las coreanas que dedican todo lo suyo para la prosperidad de la patria y la felicidad de la gran familia socialista.
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 10 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la ceremonia inaugural.
